{{DISPLAYTITLE:A_FogSpawn}} '''A_FogSpawn'''
(no parameters) Decrements the calling actor's special1 field and does nothing if this value is still positive. Otherwise, reset this field to the value from the calling actor's args[2] field. This value therefore serves as a frequency control on an inverse scale: the larger the value, the less often will calls to this function spawn anything. Randomly spawns at the calling actor's position a {{Class|FogPatchSmall|small}}, {{Class|FogPatchMedium|medium}} or {{Class|FogPatchLarge|large}} fog patch. The patch is given an angle corresponding to the spawner's angle plus a random deviation computed from the spawner's args[1] field: each point of args[1] corresponds to a maximum of about 0.7Â° of deviation either clockwise or counterclockwise. In addition, the patch is also given values for its args[] and special2 fields which are meant to influence how the patch moves and how long it lives, see [[A_FogMove]] for further information on how fog patches react to these arguments: {| {{prettytable}} !Fog patch!!Set value!!Note |- |args[0] || randomly between 1 and the spawner's args[0]+1 || Controls speed |- |args[3] || spawner's args[3] || Controls lifetime |- |args[4] || 1 || Flags the fog patch as moving |- |special2 || randomly between 0 and 63 || Used for vertical bobbing |} This codepointer is restricted to {{Class|FogSpawner}} and derived classes.
